text: Eliphaz’s Second Response to Job
Then\f + \fr 15:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
“Should \add the\add* wise answer \add with\add* windy knowledge,
and should he fill his stomach \add with the\add* east wind?
Should he argue in talk \add that\add* is not profitable
or \add in\add* words with which he cannot do good?
“⸤What is worse⸥,\f + \fr 15:4 \ft Literally “Also,” or “Even” \f* you yourself\f + \fr 15:4 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* are doing away with fear,
and you are lessening meditation ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 15:4 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* God.
For your iniquity teaches your mouth,
and you choose \add the\add* tongue of \add the\add* crafty.
Your mouth condemns you, and not I;
and your lips testify against you.
“Were you born the firstborn of the human race?
And were you brought forth ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 15:7 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* \add the\add* hills?
Have you listened in God’s confidential discussion?
And do you limit wisdom to yourself?
What do you know that we do not know?
\add What\add* do you understand that \add is\add* not clear to us?
Both \add the\add* gray-haired and \add the\add* old \add are\add* among us—
⸤those older than your father⸥.\f + \fr 15:10 \ft Literally “more aged than your father \fq in \ft days” \f*
“Are the consolations of God too small for you,
a word \add spoken\add* gently with you?
Why does your heart carry you away?
And why do your eyes flash,
that you turn your spirit against God,
and you let \add such\add* words go out of your mouth?
“What \add is\add* a human being, that he can be clean,
or\f + \fr 15:14 \ft Or “and” \f* that \add one\add* born of a woman can be righteous?
Look, he does not trust his holy ones,
and \add the\add* heavens are not clean in his eyes.
⸤How much less⸥\f + \fr 15:16 \ft Literally “Also for,” or “Indeed for,” or “Indeed that” \f* he who is abominable and corrupt,\f + \fr 15:16 \ft Or “he who is corrupt” \f*
a man drinking wickedness like water.
“I will show you, listen to me;
and what I have seen, I will tell\f + \fr 15:17 \ft Literally “and I will tell” \f*—
what wise men have told,
and they have not hidden \add that which is\add* from their ancestors,
⸤to whom alone⸥\f + \fr 15:19 \ft Literally “to them to alone them” \f* the land was given,
and no stranger passed through their midst.
“All of the wicked \add one’s\add* days he is writhing,
even\f + \fr 15:20 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add through\add* the number of years that are laid up for the tyrant.
Sounds of terror \add are\add* in his ears;
in prosperity \add the\add* destroyer will come \add against\add* him.
⸤He cannot trust that he will return⸥\f + \fr 15:22 \ft Literally “He cannot trust to return,” or “He is not certain to return,” or “He cannot be sure to return” (compare NJPS) \f* from darkness,
and he himself\f + \fr 15:22 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* is destined for \add the\add* sword.
“He is wandering for bread, \add saying\add*, ‘Where \add is it\add*?’
He knows that a day of darkness \add is\add* ready ⸤at hand⸥.\f + \fr 15:23 \ft Hebrew “at his hand”; the meaning seems to be, “his ruin is certain” \f*
Anguish and distress terrify him;
they\f + \fr 15:24 \ft Hebrew “it” \f* overpower him like a king ready for the battle.
Because he stretched out his hand against God,
and he was arrogant to Shaddai;
he ⸤stubbornly⸥\f + \fr 15:26 \ft Literally “with neck” \f* runs against him
⸤with his thick-bossed shield⸥.\f + \fr 15:26 \ft Literally “with the thickness of the boss of his shield” \f*
“Because he has covered his face with his fat
and has gathered fat upon \add his\add* loins,
⸤he will dwell⸥\f + \fr 15:28 \ft Hebrew “and he will dwell” \f* \add in\add* desolate cities,
in houses that they should not inhabit,
which are destined for rubble.
He will not become rich, and his wealth will not endure,
and their possessions will not stretch across the earth.\f + \fr 15:29 \ft See HCSB, ESV; or “will not reach to the earth”; perhaps “his possessions will not go to the underworld” \f*
“He will not escape from darkness;
a flame will dry up his new shoot,
and by the wind of his mouth he shall be removed.
Let him not trust in emptiness—he will be deceiving himself—
for worthlessness will be his recompense.
It will be paid in full ⸤before his time⸥,\f + \fr 15:32 \ft Literally “in not his day,” or “without his day” \f*
and his branch will not flourish.
“He will shake off his unripe fruit like the vine,
and he will cast off his blossom like the olive tree;
for \add the\add* company of \add the\add* godless \add is\add* barren,
and fire consumes the tents of those who accept bribes.
\add They\add* conceive trouble and bring forth mischief,
and their womb prepares deceit.”
